comments.text:

comments.author: J.J. Kuchenmeister

comments.text:
They should do a Crossfire version with Bill O and John Stewart. I know 
they've debated three times already but it would be absolutely awesome if 
they had a regular show, debating weekly events, with panelists.
comments.author: MrBeatboxmasta

top_comment.text:
It really bugs me how things have been going crazy in Ukraine recently and 
TYT hasn't made a single video about it since they talked about the 
Parliament building takeover (which was before we even knew for sure it was 
Russia). I really have been disappointed with TYT lately.  ﻿
top_comment.author: lancedance2

comments.text:
+lancedance2
To be fair, I think most of the time they don't even know what they are.
comments.author: g0r3g4sm

comments.text:
+morning morality Watch their trailer, they say they are the number 1 news 
channel on the internet.
comments.author: lancedance2

comments.text:
+morning morality Of course, that explains it, as the Ukraine assuredly 
hasn't been a news "event" of late, no?
comments.author: bobbytiger

comments.text:
+lancedance2 they are not a news channel they are a discussion channel that 
talks about News events
comments.author: morning morality

comments.text:
+lancedance2 Don't fret, they will cover it, right after about 10 more 
videos attacking those dastardly Republicans. It's what they do.  And 
speaking of Republicans, (which I am), I wonder what TYT's take is on 
Obamas response to Romney during the debates, when he criticized Romney for 
saying that Russia was still a threat to us.  I believe he said "the cold 
war has been over since the '80's.  Smart guy, that Obama, huh?
comments.author: bobbytiger

comments.text:
I suspect that their take would be the same as almost everyone else's.  
Issue another "stern" warning, throw in a sanction or two, and then get 
back to other matters on which we might have a real interest in.  In other 
words, the US won't, and shouldn't, do squat.
comments.author: bobbytiger

comments.text: +Just_Bri finally, and no.
comments.author: lancedance2

comments.text:

and didn't know all the facts.

comments.text:

comments.author: Just_Bri

comments.text:

against Republicans recently which has dominated most of their recent 
videos. Nothing wrong with disagreeing with Republicans but I want news, 
not attacks against people I don't care about.
comments.author: lancedance2

comments.text:
Don't worry, they'll cover it. They're just slow as fuck and need a few 
days.
comments.author: g0r3g4sm

comments.text:
+101chickendance I'm disappointed because it seems they have put Ukraine to 
the side to attack Republicans, which many of the recent videos were doing. 
This is supposed to be a news channel so why is it being used to attack 
people? Things are going on in the world, I want to know about that.
comments.author: lancedance2

comments.text:
I wouldnt say disappointed, but they should cover it considering the 
powerful stuff that has been happening.

If you can fight and die for your country at 18 you should be able to

comments.author: Jeremy Boney

comments.text:
I'm more for raising the age you can enroll in the military to 21 then 
dropping the drinking age.
comments.author: watwud Scooby Doo

top_comment.text:

top_comment.author: Answering Disbelievers

comments.text: Bullshit asshole. You lying piece of shit.
comments.author: Guillermo Sanchez

comments.text:
That list is bulshit. It does not include dark money, does not include 
individual donors like Sheldon Adelson, and does not count private pr 
campaigns. The whole fox news function as a pr agency for the right. There 
are more ways than direct legal contribution to the candidate to impact 
elections and legislation
comments.author: Vaidas Šukauskas

top_comment.text:
Silly americans not even being able to drink beer with 16. Voting is also 
allowed in my country with the age 16.﻿
top_comment.author: RedKryptonGames

comments.text:
+Aggiesgigem
How's that in any way related to the matter at hand? He pointed out that in 
most other western countries the legal drinking age is either 16 or 18, and 
that he thinks it's silly that it's 21 in the states (which it is) and all 
you can bring to the discussion is "your country doesn't matter". Seriously?

You can do all the chest beating you want, but the fact that the US is the 
current military and economic leader (although as an economic area the EU 
already outperforms the US but as the EU is not a country you can keep that 
tittle) does not mean all of your policies are sensible. You lag behind 
rest of the developped world in several key areas, including but not 
limited to education, health care and so on. You have power and relevance 
for sure, but that doesn't make you guys infallible on issues of policy.

So yeah, I'll take my irrelevant country with its better functioning 
systems and at large more sensible policies over the clusterfuck that is 
current day US any day of the week, and I'll outsource the "your country is 
irrelevant" -dickwaving to people like you.
comments.author: SatanicBunny

comments.text:
And yet, your country doesn't matter...It's irrelevant compared to the 
United States.
comments.author: Aggiesgigem

top_comment.text:
considering some of them don't come back alive..yeah they should be able to 
drink at 18..They port at other countries and goto the pubs and have a nice 
cold beer or whatever, they go home and it's sorry Sir I can't serve u but 
thanks for serving our country..The law could be modified for soldiers..﻿
top_comment.author: ozziemale74

comments.text:
+ozziemale74 It does in the sense that the reasoning behind it is somewhat 
related to the reasoning behind doing the same to the states nationwide. If 
they aren't going to push to relax the drinking age for the states it's 
probably not going to happen for military personnel on base. Allowing 
underaged drinking on bases really didn't work out so well and surrounding 
communities complained because the service members didn't always stay on 
the bases after drinking. 

Personally, I think that if you are in the military you should have the 
right to drink alcohol regardless of your age. (In the past it was possible 
to get in at 17 with signed parental permission. I'm not sure that is still 
true now that they attempting to draw down the military a bit). If there 
are problems because of that there are other ways of dealing with them 
besides just banning it for everyone.
comments.author: Cory Tollman

comments.text:
Yes they changed it in the 80's i read that on google but that has nothing 
to do with 2014..
comments.author: ozziemale74

comments.text:
The US military used to allow drinking on bases for all service members 18 
or older even if the drinking age in the state the base was located in was 
higher. Back when the US government strong armed all of the states into 
changing the drinking age to 21 the military switched it's policy so that 
the drinking age on base was the same as what that in the surrounding 
state. For awhile the only exception was the main base in San Diego, and 
that was only an attempt to prevent under aged service members from going 
to Tijuana to drink.
comments.author: Cory Tollman

top_comment.text:
Maybe instead of lowering the drinking age, why not raise the age to join 
the military?﻿
top_comment.author: NubianTribesman

comments.text:
+Joe Feranti
Nobody said they were interdependent. geez.
comments.author: NubianTribesman

comments.text:
A fallacious proposal. Just because people use the military service 
argument to advocate for a lower drinking age doesn't mean that the two are 
interdependent; in other words the appropriate age for one doesn't dictate 
the appropriate age for the other. That being said I think the common sense 
thing would be 18 for everything.
comments.author: Joe Feranti

comments.text:
Wouldn't raise the age to join the military because it's harder to 
brainwash older, they won't. stand for it they are too smart.
comments.author: luchpockets

comments.text: Why not both?
comments.author: ZiqqiPH

comments.text:
+rthqwaik
I know, but it would be nice.
comments.author: NubianTribesman

comments.text:
HA! Great solution; never going to actually happen. Ever met those 
power-hungry shitheads promoting the military? It aint happening buddy.
comments.author: rthqwaik
